Key Arguments: The bill imposes draconian controls on free speech.
It contradicts Australia's international human rights obligations and is out of step with European laws.
The bill gives the government power to silence religious and political speech.
There are no mechanisms to protect valid expression of opinion and belief.
The definitions of misinformation and disinformation are vague and allow for excessive censorship.
Government communications and certain content types are exempt, which is inconsistent.
The bill will lead to over-cautious behavior by service providers, stifling free speech.
Main Themes: Vague definitions and potential for misuse
Inconsistencies and exemptions in the bill
The importance of a contest of ideas
Notable Quotes: This Bill will impose some of the most draconian controls on free speech in the Western world.
Who holds the unequivocal, total, complete and unarguable definition of what is true?
It is perhaps the epitome of arrogance and pride to ascribe oneself to be the arbiter of all truth.
